trans-unit.source: Provides a design surface, which renders a visual representation of process flow.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> is the design surface which renders a visual representation of process flow described in workflow markup.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> offers a rich set of user interface functionality needed by the activity designers for rendering and for responding to various Windows-generated events.
Also, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> offers a set of common functions which can be used by all designers to perform certain activities.
Initializes an instance of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Initializes an instance of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> with the specified service provider.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> interface.
Adds a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter> is a component that handles messages from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.

Using the `Strategy` design pattern, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> will pass messages to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter> to be handled.

Mouse events, keyboard events, paint and layout events are passed on to a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter> associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> from client coordinates to logical coordinates.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> uses two coordinate spaces: logical and client:
Client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The upper-left corner is 0,0; x and y coordinates increase vertically and horizontally in the viewable area.
The client coordinate system is affected by the zoom level of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and by the scrollbar position.
In the logical coordinate system every object is always mapped to 0,0.
The position vertically and horizontally is not affected by zoom or scrollbar position.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to convert from client coordinates to logical coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> converted from client coordinates to logical coordinates.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> from client coordinates to logical coordinates.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> uses two coordinate spaces: logical and client:
Client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The upper-left corner is 0,0; x and y coordinates increase vertically and horizontally in the viewable area.
The client coordinate system is affected by the zoom level of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and by the scrollbar position.
In the logical coordinate system every object is always mapped to 0,0.
The position vertically and horizontally is not affected by zoom or scrollbar position.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to convert from client to logical coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> converted from client coordinates to logical coordinates.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> from client to logical coordinates.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> uses two coordinate spaces: logical and client:
Client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The upper-left corner is 0,0; x and y coordinates increase vertically and horizontally in the viewable area.
The client coordinate system is affected by the zoom level of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and by the scrollbar position.
In the logical coordinate system every object is always mapped to 0,0.
The position vertically and horizontally is not affected by zoom or scrollbar position.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> to convert from client to logical coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> converted from client coordinates to logical coordinates.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.

If you do not explicitly call the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> property is referenced.
To create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject>, you must add a reference to the `Accessibility` assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

For more information about `Dispose` and `Finalize`, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.

Enables the button on the design surface that, when clicked, changes the zoom level of the workflow design surface so that the entire workflow is displayed in the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
`true` if the dynamic button is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Ensures that the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> passed is visible, expanding parent objects and scrolling the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> as necessary.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.EnsureVisible%2A> when you are working with an object in the workflow that requires user interface cues.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.EnsureVisible%2A> will expand parent objects and scroll the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> as necessary to make the object visible on the designer.
The object to make visible.
selectableObject is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Changes the zoom level of the workflow design surface so that the entire workflow is displayed in the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
The actual zoom level is dependent upon the settings of the user's workflow designer.
Changes the zoom level to one hundred percent to display the full size of the workflow in the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Gets the service object of the specified type, if it is available.
`GetService` returns a <xref:System.Object> implementing the requested service, or a null reference (`Nothing`) if the service cannot be resolved.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the service to retrieve.

If the serviceType is `typeof(``)` then `GetService` returns a specific ; otherwise, `GetService` returns a implementing the requested service, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the service cannot be resolved.
Gets the horizontal scrollbar for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar"></xref> you can use to adjust the settings and visibility of the horizontal scrollbar.
Occurs when the `WorkflowView` finishes processing and is about to enter the idle state.
If you have tasks to perform before the thread becomes idle, attach them to this event.
Invalidates the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> and causes it to be repainted.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.InvalidateClientRectangle%2A> to cause a <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>, in client coordinates, to be added to the update region.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>, in client coordinates, to invalidate and cause to be repainted.
Invalidates the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> and causes it to be repainted.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.InvalidateLogicalRectangle%2A> to cause a <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>, in logical coordinates, to be added to the update region.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>, in logical coordinates, to invalidate and cause to be repainted.
Restores view-state information from a binary stream.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.LoadViewState%2A> restores view-state information previously saved by calling the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.SaveViewState%2A> method.
Override this method when you need to customize how a custom designer restores its view-state.
A <xref href="System.IO.BinaryReader"></xref> used to restore the view state.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> from logical to client coordinates.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> uses two coordinate spaces: logical and client:
Client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The upper-left corner is 0,0; x and y coordinates increase vertically and horizontally in the viewable area.
The client coordinate system is affected by the zoom level of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and by the scrollbar position.
In the logical coordinate system every object is always mapped to 0,0.
The position vertically and horizontally is not affected by zoom or scrollbar position.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to convert to client coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> converted from logical to client coordinates.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> from logical to screen coordinates.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> uses two coordinate spaces: logical and client:
Client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The upper-left corner is 0,0; x and y coordinates increase vertically and horizontally in the viewable area.
The client coordinate system is affected by the zoom level of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and by the scrollbar position.
In the logical coordinate system every object is always mapped to 0,0.
The position vertically and horizontally is not affected by zoom or scrollbar position.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to convert to screen coordinates.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> converted from logical to screen coordinates.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> from logical to client coordinates.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> uses two coordinate spaces: logical and client:
Client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The upper-left corner is 0,0; x and y coordinates increase vertically and horizontally in the viewable area.
The client coordinate system is affected by the zoom level of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and by the scrollbar position.
In the logical coordinate system every object is always mapped to 0,0.
The position vertically and horizontally is not affected by zoom or scrollbar position.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to convert to client coordinates.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> converted from logical to client coordinates.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> from logical to client coordinates.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> uses two coordinate spaces: logical and client:
Client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The upper-left corner is 0,0; x and y coordinates increase vertically and horizontally in the viewable area.
The client coordinate system is affected by the zoom level of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and by the scrollbar position.
In the logical coordinate system every object is always mapped to 0,0.
The position vertically and horizontally is not affected by zoom or scrollbar position.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> to convert to client coordinates.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> converted from logical to client coordinates.
Occurs when a control is added to the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnControlAdded%2A> is called when a child control is added to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The only child controls allowed are <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.HScrollBar%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.VScrollBar%2A> controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ControlEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
If the control added is not a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.HScrollBar"></xref> or <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.VScrollBar"></xref>
Occurs when a dragged item is dropped onto the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragDrop%2A> occurs when the user releases the mouse button over the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> during a drag operation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Occurs when an item is dragged into the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> bounds.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragEnter%2A> occurs when the user first drags the mouse cursor over the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> during a drag operation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Occurs when the cursor leaves the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> during a drag operation.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragLeave%2A> occurs when the user drags the mouse cursor out of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> during a drag operation.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Occurs when a drag-drop operation is in progress and the pointer is within the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> bounds.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragOver%2A> occurs when the mouse cursor moves within bounds of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Occurs during a drag operation.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnGiveFeedback%2A> occurs when a drag operation is started.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnGiveFeedback%2A> allows the source of a drag operation to modify the appearance of the mouse pointer in order to give the user visual feedback during a drag operation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GiveFeedbackEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Occurs when a key is pressed while the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> has focus.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnKeyDown%2A> occurs when a key is pressed while the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> has focus.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Occurs when a key is released while the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> has focus.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnKeyUp%2A> occurs when a key is released while the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> has focus.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that provides data about the event.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> should reposition child controls.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnLayout%2A> occurs when child controls are added or removed, when the bounds of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> changes, and when other changes occur that can affect the layout of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Occurs when the items selected by dragging the mouse changes.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseCaptureChanged%2A> occurs when the user makes a selection with the mouse that differs from any existing selection.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that provides data about the event.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> is double-clicked.
The double-click is determined by the mouse settings of the operating system.
The user can set the time between clicks of a mouse button that should be considered a double-click rather than two clicks.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs when the mouse pointer is over the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> and a mouse button is pressed.
Mouse events occur in the following order:
1.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseEnter%2A>
2.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseMove%2A>

3.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseHover%2A>/ <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseDown%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseWheel%2A>
4.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseUp%2A>
5.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseLeave%2A>
`OnMouseEnter` occurs when the mouse pointer enters the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
`OnMouseDown` occurs when the mouse pointer is over the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and a mouse button is pressed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Mouse events occur in the following order:
1.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseEnter%2A>
2.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseMove%2A>

3.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseHover%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseDown%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseWheel%2A>
4.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseUp%2A>
5.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseLeave%2A>
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseEnter%2A> occurs when the mouse pointer enters the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs when the mouse hovers over the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Mouse events occur in the following order:
1.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseEnter%2A>
2.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseMove%2A>

3.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseHover%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseDown%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseWheel%2A>
4.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseUp%2A>
5.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseLeave%2A>
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseHover%2A> occurs when the mouse pointer hovers over the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs when the mouse pointer leaves the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Mouse events occur in the following order:
1.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseEnter%2A>
2.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseMove%2A>

3.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseHover%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseDown%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseWheel%2A>
4.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseUp%2A>
5.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseLeave%2A>
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseLeave%2A> occurs when the mouse pointer leaves the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs when the mouse moves over the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Mouse events occur in the following order:
1.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseEnter%2A>
2.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseMove%2A>

3.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseHover%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseDown%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseWheel%2A>
4.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseUp%2A>
5.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseLeave%2A>
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseMove%2A> occurs when the mouse pointer moves over the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs when a mouse button is released over the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Mouse events occur in the following order:
1.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseEnter%2A>
2.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseMove%2A>

3.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseHover%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseDown%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseWheel%2A>
4.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseUp%2A>
5.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseLeave%2A>
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseUp%2A> occurs when the mouse pointer is over the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and a button is released.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs when the mouse wheel moves when the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> has focus.
Mouse events occur in the following order:
1.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseEnter%2A>
2.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseMove%2A>

3.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseHover%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseDown%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseWheel%2A>
4.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseUp%2A>
5.<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseLeave%2A>
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnMouseWheel%2A> occurs when the mouse wheel is moved over the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> is redrawn.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnPaint%2A> occurs when the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> is redrawn.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Occurs during a drag operation and allows the drag source to determine whether the drag option should be canceled.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event is raised when there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state during a drag operation.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event allows the drag source to determine whether the drag operation should be canceled.
Events related to drag operations are raised when the control is a valid drop target.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the drag effect specified.
For a list of drag effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.
Changes in the mouse cursor position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked.
If the user moves out of a window, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
If the mouse enters another control, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragEnter%2A> for that control is raised.
If the mouse moves but stays within the same control, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised.

If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the `Action` property of the event <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs>.

If the value is `DragAction.Continue`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised to continue the operation and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set.
For a list of valid drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragOver%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnGiveFeedback%2A> events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is given the most up-to-date feedback on the mouse position.

If the value is `DragAction.Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move.
If the value is `DragAction.Cancel`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.

By default, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event sets `Action` to `DragAction.Cancel` if the ESC key was pressed and sets `Action` to `DragAction.Drop` if the left, middle, or right mouse button is pressed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the event.
Called when a different designer is set as the new root designer of the design surface.
Called when the zoom level is changed.
Forces the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> to apply layout logic to all its child controls.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.PerformLayout%2A> updates all child controls in the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>, resizing and moving them as necessary.
`true` to cause the layout to update immediately; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.PrintDocument%2A> object to set the properties that describe how to print, and call the `Print` method to start the printing process.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.PrintDocument"></xref> object that sends output to a printer.
Gets or sets the print preview mode of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
`true` if print preview mode is active; otherwise, `false`.
Removes an associated <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter"></xref>.
Use a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter> to respond to designer events, such as drag events.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Gets or sets the root designer for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
The root designer of the workflow is the designer associated with the design surface of the workflow.
It contains all child designers, and subsequently all activities in the workflow.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Raised when the root designer is changed.
Saves the view-state to a binary stream.
View state is the accumulation of the values of the properties and child controls of a view.
Property values are persisted to the stream after saving and can be restored using the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.LoadViewState%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.IO.BinaryReader"></xref> used to store the view state.
Saves an image of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> to the specified stream using the specified image format.
The workflow view image is created as a bitmap.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> to save the workflow view image to.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat"></xref> to use to save the workflow view image.
stream or imageFormat contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Saves an image of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> to the specified file using the specified image format.
The workflow view image is created as a bitmap.
The path to the file in which to store the workflow view image.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat"></xref> to use to save the workflow view image.
imageFile or imageFormat contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Saves an image of the WorkflowView to the clipboard.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> from screen coordinates to logical coordinates.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> uses two coordinate spaces: logical and client:
Client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The upper-left corner is 0,0; x and y coordinates increase vertically and horizontally in the viewable area.
The client coordinate system is affected by the zoom level of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> and by the scrollbar position.
In the logical coordinate system every object is always mapped to 0,0.
The position vertically and horizontally is not affected by zoom or scrollbar position.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to convert from screen coordinates to logical coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> converted from screen coordinates to logical coordinates.
Gets or sets the position of the scrollbar on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.ScrollPosition%2A> to get or adjust the location of the scrollbar in the design surface.
A point describing the location of the scrollbar in screen coordinates.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.ShadowDepth"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.ShadowDepth%2A> to get or adjust the shadow depth of text shown on the workflow design surface.
The shadow depth in pixels.
Shows the **InfoTip** for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> with the specified text.
Shows the **InfoTip** for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> with the specified text.
The text to display on the **InfoTip**.
infoTipText is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Shows the **InfoTip** for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> with the specified title and text.
Shows the **InfoTip** for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> with the specified title and text.
The title of the **InfoTip** to display.
The text of the **InfoTip** to display.
title is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
-or-
infoTipText is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Shows a `ToolTip` at the specified location.
`ToolTips` are helpful notes to the user that display useful information about an object underneath the pointer.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.ShowInPlaceToolTip%2A> to display a `ToolTip` with the specified text and a desired location.
The text to display.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> specifying the location on the screen to place the `ToolTip`.
Gets the current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.ViewPortRectangle"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.ViewPortRectangle%2A> contains the visible area of the workflow.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that describes the area on the screen that is visible.
Gets the size of the visible area for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Gets the size of the visible area of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
A `Size` that describes the visible area of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Gets the vertical scrollbar associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.

Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.VScrollBar%2A> to get the vertical scrollbar on the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>, which you can use to make user interface adjustments.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar"></xref> you can use to adjust the settings and visibility of the horizontal scrollbar.
Processes Windows messages.
All messages are sent to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.WndProc%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView.WndProc%2A> method corresponds exactly to the Windows `WindowProc` function.
For more information about processing Windows messages, see the `WindowProc` function documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN library.
The Windows Message to process.
Gets or sets the zoom level of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
Use the zoom feature to enlarge or reduce the size of the components inside the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme> sets the minimum and maximum zoom levels for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView>.
The zoom level of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref>.
If the zoom level is less than the minimum zoom level of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme"></xref>
-or-
if the zoom level exceeds the maximum zoom level of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme"></xref>.
Occurs when the zoom setting for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> changes.
The workflow view image is created as a bitmap.
Gets the service of the specified type, if it is available.
If the `serviceType` is `CommandID` this method will return a specific `CommandID`.
For any other `Type`, `GetService` will return an Object that implements the requested service, or a null reference (`Nothing`) if the service cannot be resolved.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the service to retrieve.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> implementing the requested service, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the service cannot be resolved.
Filters out a message before it is dispatched.
The message to be dispatched.
You cannot modify this message.
`true` to filter the message and stop it from being dispatched; `false` to allow the message to continue to the next filter or control.
